low.recommendation: Your folic acid level is low. Folic acid deficiency can lead to anaemia. You are recommended to consume more whole grains, dark leafy greens, meat, eggs, and dairy products to replenish folic acid. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

high.recommendation: Your folic acid level is raised. You are encouraged to discontinue your folic acid supplements (if any). Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

low.recommendation: Your folic acid level is low. Folic acid deficiency can lead to anaemia. You are recommended to consume more whole grains, dark leafy greens, meat, eggs, and dairy products to replenish folic acid. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

high.recommendation: Your folic acid level is raised. You are encouraged to discontinue your folic acid supplements (if any). Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

low.recommendation: Your vitamin B12 level is low, which is commonly seen in vegetarians. Vitamin B12 deficiency can lead to anaemia. You are recommended to eat more whole grains, meat, eggs, dairy products, and vitamin B12 supplements to replenish Vitamin B12. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

high.recommendation: Your vitamin B12 level is raised. You are encouraged to discontinue your vitamin B supplements (if any). Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

low.recommendation: This may be caused by a lack of iron in the diet or a chronic infection. You are recommended to take iron supplements and foods that are high in iron content. Please repeat the test in 3 months' time.

high.recommendation: This is likely related to excessive iron or alcohol intake, inflammation or problems with the liver, thyroid or kidney. You are recommended to reduce your intake of iron supplements (if any) and foods rich in iron. Please repeat the test in 2-3 months and consult your doctor if it remains high.

normal.recommendation: Your Hb electrophoretic pattern is normal. You most likely do not have thalassemia traits.

abnormal.recommendation: Your Hb electrophoretic pattern is abnormal. This is suggestive of thalassemia traits. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

possible_results.result: HbA present. Hb electrophoretic pattern is normal. No abnormal haemoglobin detected.
HbA present. Hb electrophoresis shows normal pattern. Please rule out other causes of anaemia.

Hb electrophoresis screen did not detect any abnormal band. The low red cell indices may suggest Thalassaemia trait and/or iron deficiency. Please correlate with family history and other clinical findings. A more definitive assessment for Thalassaemia trait requires
possible_results.recommendation: Your Hb electrophoretic pattern is suggestive of thalassemia traits. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

possible_results.result: Hb electrophoresis screen did not detect any abnormal band. The low red cell indices may suggest Thalassaemia trait and/or iron deficiency. Please correlate with family history and other clinical findings. A more definitive assessment for Thalassaemia trait requires Thalassaemia DNA screen.
HbA present. Hb-H inclusion bodies less than 1 percent. Suggestive of Alpha-Thalassaemia Trait.
HbA present. Suggestive of Beta-Thalassaemia minor

Hb Electrophoresis screening - query abnormal band detected. HbD zone:23.4%. Z1 zone:0.4%. Suggest to send to SGH, Thalassaemia lab for Hb electrophoresis confirmation. Please correlate with other Clinical and laboratory findings and family history. The tests had been confirmed by repeat analysis.

Hb present. Hb electrophoresis pattern is normal. In view of low HbA2, other causes of anemia cannot be excluded. A more definitive assessment for Thalassaemia trait require DNA Thalassaemia screen. Please correlate with other clinical and laboratory findings and family history. The tests had been confirmed by repeat analysis.
HbE zone: 94.0%.Suggestive of Hb-E Homozygous. Please correlate with other clinical and laboratory findings and family history. The tests had been confirmed by repeat analysis.
